Item.Name: Harmony Kingdom BEER NUTS Canadian Exclusive
Item.Description: Harmony Kingdom BEER NUTS Canadian Exclusive EXCLUSIVE CANADIAN LIMITED EDITION OF 2001 PIECES ONLY AVAILABLE IN CANADA LAST YEAR. The Canadian adventures of Mad Murphy and Moose continue! National symbols of Canada abound on this Box Figurine. Two beavers, Canada s national animal, appear on the piece, one chewing on Moose's skis, the other hitching a free ride on his back. Moose s blanket is emblazoned with a maple leaf and the hat on his head looks suspiciously like standard issue for the RCMP (Royal Canadian Murphy/Moose Police). The area is littered with beer bottles and cans. A few are even stuck in Moose s antlers and a keg is under his belly. Moose has strapped a second keg around his neck, just in case he gets lost or stranded as he evades the RMCP. For ammunition the desperadoes have stockpiled snowballs for those sudden battles with Sgt. Jacques Strappe. The ten snowballs represent Canada s ten provinces. Inside the box is Mad Murphy, who has again foiled the RCMP s attempts to find and capture him. Carvings include Rich Little, a famous Canadian impersonator; DB McKenzie for two well-known brothers; Sir John EH for Sir John A. McDonald, Canada s first Prime Minister, and a play on the Canadian expression eh ; and BA (heart) BA stands for Bryan Amyot loves Brenda Amyot (his wife). Item is mint with box. Winning bidder may pay with credit card online with Pay Pal or Billpoint. Checks, money orders and bidpay also accepted. Please include $6 for shipping and handling. International winners please contact us for revised shipping charges before paying. Discounted shipping on multiple purchases. Good luck !! Buyer to pay $6.00 for shipping and handling. Item.Name: Marvel Comics Grey Hulk Pin
Item.Description: Produced by Planet Studios in the early 1990's, this was a limited edition metal enamel pin. They produced many different pins, mostly of Marvel Comics characters, each of which was produced only one time, in limted numbers, just as a comic book would be, ranging in size from 7/8" to 1 1/2" high. They were distributed only by comic distributors to comic book shops, and so had very limited distribution as well. All of this makes these very hard to find today. Check our current auctions for other great items, including additional pins and Marvel Comics merchandise. WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYPAL!! Checks drawn on U.S. banks, and payable in U.S. funds, are accepted for payment but require seven business days to clear. Credit cards (MC, Visa, Amex, Discover) and money order/cashiers check payments ship within two business days of receipt. Buyer pays $1.50 shipping and handling fee. Please check my ME site to some of the stars I've worked with, at http://members.ebay.com/aboutme/joe_motes Since many autographs in the convention and internet market are forgeries, I suggest you visit the UACC Forgery site at www.uacc.org/forgeries.htm I mail all items Priority and Insured for you protection and mine within the USA and postage will be appropriate to the total amount of your high bid item(s) and weight. I do not know if this is original, but someone has attached a magnetic strip inside the door so it will stay shut. I'm not sure how to address condition. It could use a nice cleaning. Some of the paint has chipped off inside. The outside has some wear as well. There is no manufacturer information. If you like this color, my other auctions include a matching turntable/lazy susan with two jars. This is not my area of expertise. If you feel I have failed to address something, please let me know. Item.Name: Marvel Comics Silver Surfer Logo Pin
Item.Description: Produced by Planet Studios in the early 1990's, this was a limited edition metal enamel pin. They produced many different pins, mostly of Marvel Comics characters, each of which was produced only one time, in limted numbers, just as a comic book would be, ranging in size from 7/8" to 1 1/2" high. They were distributed only by comic distributors to comic book shops, and so had very limited distribution as well. All of this makes these very hard to find today. Check our current auctions for other great items, including additional pins and Marvel Comics merchandise. WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYPAL!! Checks drawn on U.S. banks, and payable in U.S. funds, are accepted for payment but require seven business days to clear. Credit cards (MC, Visa, Amex, Discover) and money order/cashiers check payments ship within two business days of receipt. Buyer pays $1.50 shipping and handling fee. We ship U.S. Postal Service within the the United States. International shipments and other forms of delivery may be more. ATTENTION AOL USERS! Item.Name: - RARE 50s Shafford Black CAT Decanter CRUET
Item.Description: This great old black cat decanter is unmarked, but I am quite sure it is from the Shafford collection. It is made of the red clay, and has the green eyes, red bow and ear linings. She has lost most of her red from her ears, and neck bow, but has most of her green eye paint, and nice features painted on her face. The glaze has some crazing, but no cracks or chips. This decanter measures approx. 7 1/2" tall with her lid on. A very nice addition to your Shafford Black cat collection. Buyer pays postage. I accept Paypal, Billpoint, Bidpay as well as international money orders, sending item when payment clears. Thank you for looking! Image Hosting @ BayPal

Item.Name: Siegfried & Roy Showbiz Japan Mag June 2001
Item.Description: Siegfried & Roy are the cover story of this nicely done issue of Showbiz Japan magazine dated June 2001. This unique publication is written completely in Japanese and focuses on Las Vegas as a tourist destination. Features include a two-page lead story on Siegfried & Roy, and also a one-page article on Tom Jones. Also contains assorted listings and advertisements for Las Vegas shopping and events. The format of this publication is undersized (5-1/4" x 8"), reads right to left, and is 48 pages in length. A nice addition to any Siegfried & Roy, Tom Jones, or Las Vegas memorabilia collection. Winning bidder pays $3.95 priority postage within the United States. Postage may be slightly higher to non-U.S. destinations. Payment is due 10 days from end of auction. Item.Description: This is a wonderful 9pc lot of sterling silver including a small fork & spoon and seven other teaspoons. The small pair measures 4-4_" and they may be children's pieces. Item.Name: Metal Nutgrinder Androck 49 Retro Kitchen
Item.Description: This early kitchen item is probably a nut grinder. I doubt if the blades would do coffee, but I could be mistaken. POssibly garlic, or other herb type garden items or spices. The metal handle turns the blades inside the little shoot that holds the nuts to be ground. As they get pieced into little bits, they fall into the Androck jar below. The blue and black and white design feels very early 50's maybe even 40's, and since the number 49 is on the jar, I would place it in this time frame. The blades are somewhat rusty and would need some cleaning it you planned on actually using this. But if you're just adding to your decor in a retro kitchen, it would be fine as it is. Ther is a little bit of ridges on one side, the lowest, and looks like a match striker to me, so maybe this piece did double duty when setting on or near a stove that had to be lit. I cannot think of any other use for the ridges, so if you know, please let me know. Bid early and stake your claim to this unusual piece. See pics and email questions. Item.Name: PHANTOM Frew Comic #227
Item.Description: You are bidding on 1 issue of "The Phantom" comic book. You get issue #227 in this auction. I don't know alot about comic books, but I will tell you what I can about this one. I think that this one is from the 1960's and was printed in Australia. Just inside the front cover at the bottom of the page it says the following: Distributors-Gordon & Gotch (A'sia) LTD., Sydney Melbourne. On the bottom of the last page it says the following: Printed by Rotary Colorprint Co. Pty. Ltd., 15 Hamilton St., Sydney. Published by Frew Publications Pty. Limited, 149 Castlereagh St., Sydney. The cover is printed in color and the interior pages are all Black & White. The comic contains 32 pages and has a price of 1 pound(?)on the front cover. The cover is a newspaper type paper and does not have the glossy type finish as most comic books do. The comic is in what I would call Excellent condition, maybe better, no major tears. There is no writing on the cover or inside that I have found. The comic measures about 10"x7". Please ask questions before bidding, and I will try to answer them the best that I can. CHECK OUT MY OTHER ON GOING AUCTIONS FOR MORE INTERESTING ITEMS, AND MORE PHANTOM COMICS TO BE ADDED IN THE NEXT FEW DAYS. Shipping can be combined on these auctions, if you win more than one. Buyer to pay by money order, paypal, or check in U.S. funds, however checks will delay shipping by at least 10 days. Buyer to also pay $3.95, for Priority Mail shipping, add an additional $1.10, if you want insurance (I will not be resonsible for uninsured items). Buyer to also make payment within 14 days of the end of the auction or items may be re-sold. E-mail me with any questions and I will try to answer them. International shipping will be higher.

Item.Name: The Wrapper #178 G-Men Heroes Law Bazooka Joe
Item.Description: Auction Wizard Listing Template - AWLOT#:867 The Wrapper #178 G-Men Heroes Law Bazooka Joe The Wrapper magazine has news, reader comments and articles on non-sports trading cards as well as on wrappers, wax packs, and display boxes. Some issues also have additional text pertaining to other related collectibles. The Wrapper is devoted primarily to the older card sets and contains scores of pages of ads from dealers and collectors from all over the world offering to buy, sell, and trade non-sports collectibles. And when looking through these back issues, it's very interesting to see how prices have changed over the years. Makes you long for "the good old days". The Wrapper issue # 178 is complete and in excellent condition. Check out my other auctions now on eBay, including many other back issues of The Wrapper Non-Sports Gum Cards & Related Collectibles magazine, and save on postage. Winner pays shipping. Item.Name: Tilda Swinton"Female Perversions"Lesbian DVD
Item.Description: Tilda Swinton"Female Perversions"Lesbian DVD PHOTO: DESCRIPTION: Tilda Swinton"Female Perversions" All codes IMPORT Lesbian DVD Directed by SUSAN STREITFELD Starring : TILDA SWINTON, AMY MADIGAN, KAREN SILLAS, FRANCES FISHER_K_K. This is a terrific film about women struggling to discover a way to find and develop their identity. While some of the allusions and metaphors can be a bit heavy handed, they are effective. Eve (Tilda Swinton) is a lawyer about to be nominated for a judgeship. While her professional life is as much as she could wish, her personal life is a mess. She is involved with an architect (male) and a psychotherapist, Renee. But she is unable to connect with either. Her upbringing, devotion to her work, and desperate desire for control have left her emotionally stunted, unable to make a real connection to anyone around her. One day, her sister is picked up for shoplifting. Eve rides to her rescue, and spends several days in the middle of nowhere, with an exotic dancer, a young girl just entering puberty, and a brilliant but shattered friend. Many critics hated this movie (most guides give it just 2 or 3 stars) but I think they couldn't get past Eve's coldness. But this movie is a study in coldness, in emotional death and rebirth. But it is not Eve who is reborn. See it and judge for yourself._K_K Country: USA 1996 NTSC Brand New & Factory Sealed! ALL CODES so that it is playable worldwide!!! Dolby Digital Original in English language with optional English / Chinese subtitles. SHIPPING & PAYMENT: High Bidder pays US$7 shipping cost Worldwide, US$2 for each additional DVD. Item.Name: 1-TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES KIT
Item.Description: 1-TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES KIT 1- Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Kit. LOT #TMNTKT. Kit includes complete set of 66 collector cards (Topps Wax), Eastman and Laird's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Volume 1 Comic Book, Kevin Eastman AUTOGRAPHED Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Comic Book: Issue 3, and Kevin Eastman AUTOGRAPHED Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 3-D Movie Magazine. Get a full dose of TURTLE POWER! In the complete Topps set. All your heroes_ MICHAELANGELO, LEONARDO, RAPHAEL, and DONATELLO are in this box. Also in the set is Eastman and Laird's Turtles Volume 1 Comic book. The story in this book, "Metamorphosis" is strong and well told and the art fun and powerful. The full color pages are printed on high. It's filled to the max of action-packed Turtles adventure. The Kevin Eastman AUTOGRAPHED 3rd issue of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles adds more drama to the Turtles scene. Eastman's AUTOGRAPH is in bold silver on the colorful cover. Inside the book, the masterfully penciled drawings create the world of danger and suspicion in which the turtles live with April O'Neil, their rat master, Splinter, and their arch nemesis, the dreaded Shredder. The third issue of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is pivotal in the development of both the book and of Mirage Studios. In the book, the turtles meet April and leave the stormdrains to live in the world above when they loose their master, Splinter. The issue comes with a CERTIFICATE OF AUTHENTICITY from Catch A Star Collectible, Inc. Kevin Eastman also AUTOGRAPHED a limited edition Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 3-D Movie Magazine that comes with a CERTIFICATE OF AUTHENTICITY. The awesome 3-D magazine cover featuring Michaelangelo has Kevin Eastman's silver AUTOGRAPH and is numbered up to 9,500. It is part of a special collector's edition in celebration of the turtle movie, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles III: The Turtles Are Back_In Time. Inside you'll find their exclusive photo-comic adaptation of the movie, as well as a look at the cast of characters in the action-packed flick. You can go behind the scenes to find out how the story was brought to life and meet the stunt people who hurl themselves from castle windows, storm stone walls, and do other deeds of daring. Articles can also be found about ancient Japan. There's also a once-in-a-lifetime pullout portrait of Team Turtle by Peter Laird, their co-creator. This Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Kit is the perfect addition to any Turtle fan's collection. Cowabunga, dude!! Buyer pays actual shipping/handling, UPS/US MAIL. Item.Name: Jeff George signed 8x10 Redskins photo
Item.Description: .titledata { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:18px; color:#FC1230; } .description { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color:#000000; } .link { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:12px; underline; } HR { color: #000000; } Jeff George signed 8x10 Redskins photo Click image to view larger version Spotlight Productions The item we are making available is a full color 8x10 hand signed by Jeff George. Get to know your seller! We started collecting sports memorabilia about 10 years ago, just for personal collections. We bought items from local sellers, but that was not without a large price tag, as I_m sure we can all relate to :) Our passion for sports memorabilia progressed into wanting to meet our favorite players, so we went through different contacts and getting our autographs that way. Now we travel all over to different events getting autographs in person, hand signed by top athletes and celebrities of today and yesterday. Now I must let you know, that we still DO PURCHASE autographs, and NOT every autograph we sell has been witnessed by us, however we do OUR VERY BEST to ensure that the autographs we sell are only TOP QUALITY and 100% real. That is why we issue a CERTIFICATE OF AUTHENTICITY from Spotlight Productions, backed with our full refund guarantee that if you are not completely satisfied with your product, SEND IT BACK ! We don_t want anyone to ever have any displeasure associated with our name! And we mean that! Collecting sports memorabilia should be a wonderful and fun hobby, and we hope that we can assist you in collecting the items you will treasure for years to come!!! Happy Bidding. PLEASE NOTE!!! We accept Paypal, Money orders, Cashiers and Personal Checks. We reserve the right, and WILL NOT ship to UNVERIFIED PAYPAL ADDRESSES . If you forget to include your address with paypal, we WILL deny payment and it will have to be sent again. Also note that while we do happily accept personal checks, there will be at least a 10 day clearing period. Paypal VERIFIED, Money orders and Cashiers checks ship immediately upon receipt. Delivery confirmation and/or insurance is $2.50 extra for the first $50 to be insured. Multiple item shipping is available (to be disclosed after winning the auction) Payment I accept the following forms of payment: PayPal, Money Order, Personal Check. Item.Name: First Day Covers - Postal Commemoratives
Item.Description: if (navigator.appName == 'Microsoft Internet Explorer') { if (navigator.appVersion.substring(0,1) "); } else { document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" BODY { background: url(http://home.att.net/~skaggirl/gold.gif) }"); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); } } else { //Default to Netscape settings. document.write(" "); } First Day Covers - Postal Commemoratives I have here a book of - U.S. First Day Covers & Special Covers, from the Postal Commemorative Society. It starts with the - America's Space Achievements First day issue, postmarked - Kennedy Space Center, Fl. 1981, next is - National Archives 50th Anniversary, postmarked - Washington, D.C. April, 1984, next is the - 1984 Summer Olympic Games, postmarked - Los Angeles, CA. May 1984, next is another - 1984 Summer5 Olympic Games, postmarked the same as the first one, next is the - Louisiana World Exposition, postmarked - New Orleans, LA. 1984, next is - A Tribute to Health Research 100 Anniversary of Sloan-Kettering Center, postmarked - New York, N.Y. 1984, next is - Douglas Fairbanks. postmarked - Denver, CO. 1984, next is - Jime Thorpe, postmarked - Shawnee, OK 1984, next is - John McCormack Irish Tenor, postmarked - Boston, MA. 1984, next is - 25th Anniversary St. Lawrence Seaway Opening, postmarked - Massena, N.Y. 1984, next is - Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamp Act 50th Anniversary, postmarked - Des Moines, IA. 1984, next is - Quadricentennial Roanoke Voyages North Carolina, postmarked - Manteo, N.C. 1984, next is - A Tribute to Herman Melville - Novelist-Poet, postmarked - New Bedford, MA. 1984, next is - A Tribute to Horace Moses Founder of Junior Achievement, postmarked - Bloomingon, IN. 1984, next is - Saluting Forest Fire Prevention, postmarked - Capitan, NM. 1984, next is - Roberto Clemente, postmarked - Carolina, PR. 1984. There is 16 in all, and all of them are in great condition, I have coverd up the name and address of who they were sent to, in my pictures, so if it looks fuzzy right there thats why, they don't look like that, they do have someones name and address on all of them. Item.Description: You are bidding on 1 BRIGHT UNCIRCULATED (BU) STATEHOOD QUARTER. Please read the shipping and handling charges below before you bid. This coin comes straight from FRESH US MINT BAGS, they are BU uncirculated and handled with cotton gloves, The coin will be shipped in 1.5 X 1.5 plastic coin holders. A wonderful addition to any personal collection ....The design honors the "Green Mountain State," the first state admitted to the Union after the original 13 colonies. Vermont is most famous for its skiing and the production of maple sugar and syrup. Until the 1800s when cane sugar was introduced, Americans relied on Vermont's maple sugar for much of its sugar supply. Also featured on the quarter is Camel's Hump Mountain in the northern half of Vermont's Green Mountains. Camel's Hump is easily recognized by its unique double-humped profile and is one of the highest peaks in Vermont. MAKE SURE TO SEE MY OTHER AUCTIONS FOR ALL YOUR STATE QUARTER NEEDS U.S. SHIPPING AND HANDLING IS $1.75 FOR EACH COIN, CANADA $3.50, OVERSEAS $4.50. Insurance is $1.10 extra. Item.Name: NINE DIFFERENT STANDING LIBERTY QUARTERS nr
Item.Description: NINE DIFFERENT STANDING LIBERTY QUARTERS NO RESERVE !! This is a group of nine U.S. Standing Liberty silver (.900) quarters dated from 1925 to 1930. These quarters were struck at various U.S. Mints. [Look for the mintmark on the obverse at 7 o'clock to the left of Liberty's robe.] These quarters are all well circulated but still collectible. Here are the nine Standing Liberty silver quarters you get with my estimate of their grades: 1925(P) VG 1926(P) G-VG 1926-D G 1928(P) G-VG 1928-S G 1928-D AG-G 1929(P) VG 1930(P) VG-F 1930-S VG-F [Note: struck on a clipped planchet, ~1.5%, at 7:30 o'clock] Check out the photographs below. This group is especially well suited to beginning collectors of this hard to find Liberty Standing series as well as inexpensive place-holders for regular collectors. They would also make a great gift for your favorite numismatist. U.S. buyers must pay $3.50 to help with postage; Canadian buyers $4.75; Outside North America $10.00. Checks and money orders drawn in U.S. dollars on any bank outside the U.S. are welcome, but you must include an additional $3.50 to cover correspondent bank fees.

Item.Description: _ Please view our eBay auctions: All auction items Our Hard Drive onchinahd 35HD HDIBMl060 Payment: We accept payment by approved Paypal, Visa, Mastercard, money order or cashiers check processed immediately and will be shipped out on the same day. California residents add 8.00% sales tax. Any orders that come in after 2:00 pm we can not gaurantee that it will be shipped on the same day. Anything being shipped USPS goes out every Tuesday morning and Friday morning. Currently we only ship to the United States and do not accept international orders. Warranty: 1 Year Warranty: W e issue refund, minus the freight charge, for any return within 30 days. Thereafter we issue replacement for any RMA for up to 1 year. If any defects in material and workmanship appear during the warranty period, please mail to sales@onchina.com Subj: RMA for a RMA number. Damaged product will be replaced or repaired at our option. This warranty does not cover normal wear and tear, improper handling or accidental damage caused by travel carriers. Note: We do not refund the freight portion. _ 60GB IBM Deskstar 60GXP 7200RPM HARD Drive (IBM IC35L060AVER07) auction by usmtelecom Highlights The award-winning IBM Deskstar* family provides industry-leading performance at 7200 RPM, 494 Mbits/sec internal transfer rates, and 8.5 ms average seek times- enabling sustained data rates of up to 40 MB/sec. Capacities range from 20 to 60 GB. An Ultra ATA/100 interface optimizes system performance. Unique design attributes enable shock protection to 400 G. Reduced acoustics enable extremely quiet operation at 3.1 Bels. Idle power consumes only 6.7 watts. Leading drive technology The IBM Deskstar 60GXP disk drive combines new and proven technologies to greatly enhance system performance and capacity--handling a wide range of advanced desktop and audio/video applications. Features such as low acoustics, reduced power, and tagged command queuing are ideal for low-cost routers, entry- level servers, and switches. Advanced desktop systems IBM continues to define state-of-the-art for storage. The high capacities and fast speeds of IBM Deskstar drives support higher quality digital audio/video storage, superior digital content creation capabilities, and significantly faster processing for multimedia and Internet applications. Technology for performance Increased track capacity and servo bandwidth combine with enhanced buffer throughput to significantly improve performance over the previous generation IBM drive. A 2 MB buffer uses advanced buffer management and hardware assisted caching to streamline data transfer. In addition, more servo pulses help ensure faster and more accurate head positioning to reduce head settling time. The IBM Deskstar 60GXP also supports Tagged Command Queuing and Rotational Position Optimization to further enhance throughput for data-intensive Windows NT** and UNIX** applications. Technology for reliability The industry's highest areal density increases capacity while reducing component count to improve reliability. Second-generation load/unload head ramps help protect data from drive mishandling, further enhancing reliability. In addition, glass media provides a smoother disk surface and greater rigidity to reduce the impact of shock. Ceramic spindle bearings and a tri-lamenate top cover reduce acoustics to just 3.1 Bels--a level that matches or improves upon many 5400 RPM models. Circuits and motors are also optimized to save power and reduce system temperature- extending system life and reliability. Deskstar drives utilize proven IBM technologies such as TrueTrack* servo and No- ID* sector formatting, as well as IBM Drive Fitness Test* (DFT), S.M.A.R.T. Self Test, and error logging. _ IBM Deskstar 60GXP at a glance Configuration Interface ATA Capacity (GB) 60GB Sector size (bytes) 512 Recording zones 18 User cylinders (physical) 27,724 Data heads (physical) 6/4/2 Data disks 3/2/1 Max. areal density (Gbits/sq. inch) 15.3 Max. recording density (BPI) 449k Track density (TPI) 34,000 Performance Data buffer 2MB Rotational speed (RPM) 7200 Latency (average ms) 4.17 Media transfer rate (max Mbits/sec) 494 Interface transfer rate (max MB/sec) 100 Sustained data rate (MB/sec) 20.9 to 40.8 Seek time (read typical) _ _Average (ms) 8.5 _ _Track-to-track (ms) 1.2 _ _Full-track (ms) 15.0 Reliability Error rate (nonrecoverable) 1 in 10E13 Start stop cycles (load/unload at 40_ C) 40,000 Power Requirement +5 VDC (+- 5%), +12 VDC (+10%/-8%) Dissipation (typical) _ _Startup current _ _(max A) 2.0(12v) _ _Idle (W) 6.7(3,2,1 disks) Physical size Height (mm) 25.4 Width (mm) 101.6 Depth (mm) 146 Weight (max g) 590 (3 disks), 575 (2 disks), 560 (1 disk) Environmental characteristics _ Operating Nonoperating Ambient temperature 5 to 55_ C -40 to 65_ C Relative humidity (noncondensing) 8% to 90% 5% to 95% Maximum wet bulb (noncondensing) 29.4_ C 35_ C Shock (half sine wave) 55_G/2_ms 400 G (2, 1 disks)_ 350 G (3 disks)_ _ Vibration (random [RMS]) 0.67 G_for_horizontal, 0.56_for_vertical 1.04 G Acoustics (idle) Bels 3.1 (3 disks), 3.0 (2 disks), 2.9 (1 disk) _ The above information exerted from IBM website.
